result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth J. Groholski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

Cash bond amended from $500 to Signature Bond on Case 14CF131.
All other conditions remain the same.

Defendant Kenneth J Groholski in court with attorney Karl A. Schmidt. Defendant Kenneth J Groholski in CUSTODY. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 13CF229 and 14CF131.

9:03 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
13CF229:
Count 1 - guilty
Count 2 - DRI

14CF131:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
PSI to be ordered  
Sentencing to be set for September 5, 2014 at 11:00 a.m.

Atty Arendt requests the bond be modified in 14CF131 to be modified.
Atty Cousins does not object to the bond modified to a signature bond with 81 days of jail credit.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is modified from Cash bond of $500 to Signature bond with all other conditions remaining the same.

Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 5, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Plea hearing on July 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Plea hearing on June 30, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 30, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Court calls case at 3:23 p.m.  Defendant Kenneth J. Groholski in court with attorney Karl A Schmidt. Defendant Kenneth J. Groholski in custody. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 


Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Not Guilty Plea entered.
Bond Continued

Bond Continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 12, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Kenneth J. Groholski appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Cass Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Atty Cousins indicates Atty Schmidt is representing him but is not presently in the Courtroom.  He was here earlier. 
 

Attorney Sean P Drury in court for Atty Schmidt at this time as he is in Br 3 at this time for another appearance.
Defendant makes statements. 
Atty Drury advises defendant to wait and speak to Atty Schmidt first. 
Defendant proceeds to request a signature bond as he is currently on a PO Hold and cannot get out on the ATR unless he gets a signature bond. 

BY THE COURT:  Court will not revise as this is a Br 2 file.  Consult with attorney.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
$500 cash bond:  Comply with conditions of 13CF229.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

2:16 p.m. Defendant Kenneth J. Groholski appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Cass Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.
Defendant would like to consult with an attorney
Defendant can contact Public Defender for Representation
Court orders defendant to see Public Defender today. 

BTC: $500 cash bond:  Comply with conditions of 13CF229.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
